item.title: DNS over TLS with Unbound
item.description: Recently, Firefox announced it’s roll-out of DNS over HTTPS (DoH). That made me think, "Encrypting DNS…​ Why don’t I do that for my home network?" Well, I’ve now had the opportunity to configure my Unbound DNS resolver to encrypt it’s DNS requests. Unbound has support built-in for DoH’s sibling protocol, DNS over TLS (DoT). Instead of encrypting DNS traffic and masking it as standard HTTPS traffic, it uses the dedicated port 853.
